chapter.title: Insallation of Virtualization components
chapter.para: None of the virtualization tools is installed by default.

sect1.title: Installing &kvm;
sect1.para: To install &kvm; and KVM tools, proceed as follows:

step.para: Start &yast; and choose Virtualization Installing Hypervisor and Tools.
Select KVM server, KVM tools and confirm with Accept.
Confirm the list of packages that is to be installed with Install.

step.screen: modprobe kvm-intel # on Intel machines only modprobe kvm-amd # on AMD machines only modprobe vhost-net systemctl start libvirtd.service

note.title: The vhost-net Kernel Module
note.para: The vhost-net kernel module allows for a more efficient network transport to the guest. It is automatically used by libvirt if loaded, or when using the qemu-kvm command line, by adding ,vhost=on to the networking option.

sect1.title: Installing &xen;
sect1.para: To install &xen; and &xen; tools, proceed as follows:

step.para: Start &yast; and choose Virtualization Installing Hypervisor and Tools.
Select &xen; server, &xen; tools and confirm with Accept.
Confirm the list of packages that is to be installed with Install.

After the setup has been finished, you need to reboot the machine on a xen kernel.

sect1.title: Network Bridge
sect1.para: If you want to setup a network bridge, you just need to be Agree to set up a network bridge by clicking Yes. It is recommended using a bridge on a &vmhost; (virtual machine host). If you prefer to manually configure a different network setup, you can safely skip this step by clicking No.
